unnormalised: Okay, so bill payments, am I right? Nobody *likes* doing them, but bhai, gotta keep the lights on, literally! And these days, with everything online, it's both easier and somehow MORE confusing.
normalised: Okay, so bill payments, am I right? Nobody likes doing them, but bhai, gotta keep the lights on, literally! And these days, with everything online, it's both easier and somehow more confusing.

unnormalised: Last month, for instance, I was staring at my electricity bill from Adani Electricity – Rs. 3,450.75, to be exact. I swear, I don't even run the AC that much! And the breakdown… forget about it. "Fixed Charges: ₹250," "Energy Charges: ₹2,800," "Fuel Adjustment Cost: ₹400.75," and a bunch of other things I don't even pretend to understand. I mean, what *is* "FAC" anyway? Is that like a fuel surcharge or something?
normalised: Last month, for instance, I was staring at my electricity bill from Adani Electricity – rupees three thousand four hundred and fifty point seven five, to be exact. I swear, I don't even run the A-C that much! And the breakdown… forget about it. "Fixed Charges: rupee two hundred and fifty," "Energy Charges: rupee two thousand eight hundred," "Fuel Adjustment Cost: rupee four hundred point seven five," and a bunch of other things I don't even pretend to understand. I mean, what is "F-A-C" anyway? Is that like a fuel surcharge or something?

unnormalised: Then there's the water bill from the Mumbai Municipal Corporation. That one’s a joke; always hovering around Rs. 700 - Rs. 800. They really need to fix the pipelines in our area; the water pressure is so low half the time!
normalised: Then there's the water bill from the Mumbai Municipal Corporation. That one’s a joke; always hovering around rupees seven hundred or rupees eight hundred. They really need to fix the pipelines in our area; the water pressure is so low half the time!

unnormalised: My JioFiber bill is thankfully predictable – Rs. 699 per month (excluding GST). I wish all bills were this straightforward. Still, I remember when 1GB of data cost Rs. 250! How times have changed, eh?
normalised: My J-i-o-Fiber bill is thankfully predictable – rupees six hundred and ninety nine per month (excluding G-S-T). I wish all bills were this straightforward. Still, I remember when one G-B of data cost rupees two hundred and fifty! How times have changed, eh?

unnormalised: And don't even get me STARTED on the gas bill. Indraprastha Gas Ltd (IGL) keeps changing the price faster than I can keep up! One month it's ₹900, the next it’s ₹1100. At this rate, I'm gonna have to start cooking on a chulha again like my grandma used to!
normalised: And don't even get me started on the gas bill. Indraprastha Gas L-t-d (I-G-L) keeps changing the price faster than I can keep up! One month it's rupee nine hundred, the next it’s rupee one thousand one hundred. At this rate, I'm gonna have to start cooking on a chulha again like my grandma used to!

unnormalised: Paying these things used to be such a pain. Remember standing in line at the BEST depot to pay the electricity bill? Or mailing a cheque and hoping it wouldn't get lost in the post? No thanks!
normalised: Paying these things used to be such a pain. Remember standing in line at the B-E-S-T depot to pay the electricity bill? Or mailing a cheque and hoping it wouldn't get lost in the post? No thanks!

unnormalised: Now, I just use PhonePe for almost everything. Scan the QR code, punch in the amount, and done. I also use auto-pay for the JioFiber bill, so I never have to worry about it. Although, I once accidentally set it up to auto-pay Rs. 6,990 instead of Rs. 699! Talk about a heart attack.
normalised: Now, I just use PhonePe for almost everything. Scan the Q-R code, punch in the amount, and done. I also use auto-pay for the J-i-o-Fiber bill, so I never have to worry about it. Although, I once accidentally set it up to auto-pay rupees six thousand nine hundred and ninety instead of rupees six hundred and ninety nine! Talk about a heart attack.

unnormalised: My mom, though, she's old school. Still prefers paying everything offline. I tried to show her how to use Paytm, but she just couldn't get the hang of it. Ended up accidentally ordering 50 kgs of onions from BigBasket!
normalised: My mom, though, she's old school. Still prefers paying everything offline. I tried to show her how to use P-a-y-T-m, but she just couldn't get the hang of it. Ended up accidentally ordering fifty kilograms of onions from BigBasket!

unnormalised: So, what's the takeaway? Bills are a necessary evil, but at least technology has made paying them a little less painful. Though I still think these electricity companies should be more transparent about how they calculate those mysterious "charges." Seriously, what is a "meter rent" for Rs. 50?! And why does it fluctuate every month!
normalised: So, what's the takeaway? Bills are a necessary evil, but at least technology has made paying them a little less painful. Though I still think these electricity companies should be more transparent about how they calculate those mysterious "charges." Seriously, what is a "meter rent" for rupees fifty?! And why does it fluctuate every month!

unnormalised: Next month, I’m thinking of switching to solar power. Might be a good investment in the long run, especially with these electricity prices going through the roof! Then, I'll just have to worry about the maintenance cost of the solar panels... maybe Rs. 500/month? Another bill, another adventure, I guess!
normalised: Next month, I’m thinking of switching to solar power. Might be a good investment in the long run, especially with these electricity prices going through the roof! Then, I'll just have to worry about the maintenance cost of the solar panels... maybe rupees five hundred per month? Another bill, another adventure, I guess!
